availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew J. Tosh (Caldwell co. farmhand and corp. 15th ky cav.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Crittenden County, Kentucky native. Son of William Tosh and Nancy Tosh. Married to Mary A. Carner Tosh in Princeton, Kentucky, on October 12, 1865. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Fredonia, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from March 11, 1863 to October 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 303B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 179.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #001929335.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0135.
"Andrew Tosh (1838-1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial #18615896, , ttp://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18615896.
